docs.snippet: The Boston Red Sox will ban alcohol in the clubhouse and on the last plane flight of road trips, Manager Bobby Valentine said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Boston Red Sox will ban alcohol in the clubhouse and on the last plane flight of road trips, Manager Bobby Valentine said.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox manager Bobby Valentine establishes a ban on alcohol in the clubhouse and on the last plane flight of road trips; move comes after last season’s collapse in the American League East, a tailspin that included reports of pitchers drinking beer in the clubhouse.

docs.snippet: The Clinton Administration offered no objections in the Security Council today when a travel ban on Iraqi officials was ended, but the United States and Russia are still at an impasse over when and how to respond to a report last month that in eff...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Clinton Administration offered no objections in the Security Council today when a travel ban on Iraqi officials was ended, but the United States and Russia are still at an impasse over when and how to respond to a report last month that in effect declared Iraq free of nuclear weapons. The travel ban had never actually been imposed, and American officials said the step was not significant. But the Administration fought hard and long last fall to win Security Council backing for the measure, which would have restricted international travel for top Iraqis responsible for a lack of cooperation with the arms inspectors of the United Nations Special Commission.
docs.abstract: United Nations Security Council lifts never-imposed travel ban on Iraqi officials without objection from Clinton Administration; United States and Russia are still at impasse over when and how to respond to International Atomic Energy Agency report that in effect declared Iraq free of nuclear arms (M)

headline.main: U.N. Lifts Travel Ban on Iraqis Without Objection From U.S.

docs.snippet: Iraq said today that it would disband its million-man militia and let citizens travel abroad.   The part-time militia, called the Popular Army, was originally recruited from members of the governing Baath Party. Expanded during the 1980-88 Iran-Ir...
docs.lead_paragraph: Iraq said today that it would disband its million-man militia and let citizens travel abroad. The part-time militia, called the Popular Army, was originally recruited from members of the governing Baath Party. Expanded during the 1980-88 Iran-Iraq war, it now consists mainly of volunteers too young or too old for compulsory military service.

headline.main: Baghdad to Disband Militia and End Travel Ban

docs.snippet: Prime Minister Robert Mugabe traveled to this opposition stronghold under heavy military guard today to mark Zimbabwe's three years of black rule. He renewed his threat to outlaw the opposition Zimbabwe African People's Union if violence continued...
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Robert Mugabe traveled to this opposition stronghold under heavy military guard today to mark Zimbabwe's three years of black rule. He renewed his threat to outlaw the opposition Zimbabwe African People's Union if violence continued in the region.

headline.main: Mugabe Renews Threat To Ban Nkomo Party

docs.snippet: Some weeks ago I applied to the visa section of the American Embassy in London for a visa to the United States, in order that I might give a lecture at Harvard University on Goethe, and a few lectures at other colleges. I was asked by the vice con...
docs.lead_paragraph: Some weeks ago I applied to the visa section of the American Embassy in London for a visa to the United States, in order that I might give a lecture at Harvard University on Goethe, and a few lectures at other colleges. I was asked by the vice consul who interviewed me to declare, on oath, whether I had ever been a member of the Communist party.

headline.main: Grounds for Visa Ban; Effect of Law Barring Entry for Past Beliefs Is Considered

docs.snippet: Pakistan on Friday lifted a travel ban on a prominent journalist over an article he wrote about an alleged rift between the country's government and powerful military, but sternly warned media against publishing reports against the national intere...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pakistan on Friday lifted a travel ban on a prominent journalist over an article he wrote about an alleged rift between the country's government and powerful military, but sternly warned media against publishing reports against the national interest.

headline.main: Pakistan Lifts Travel Ban for Journalist but Warns Media
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Lifts Travel Ban for Journalist but Warns Media

docs.snippet: Minnesota State-Mankato's baseball coach on Wednesday lamented the lost opportunity for his team if it were to qualify for the NCAA Division II championship and couldn't play because the tournament is in North Carolina....
docs.lead_paragraph: Minnesota State-Mankato's baseball coach on Wednesday lamented the lost opportunity for his team if it were to qualify for the NCAA Division II championship and couldn't play because the tournament is in North Carolina.

headline.main: Coach: NC Travel Ban to Cost Minnesota Athletes Opportunity
headline.print_headline: Coach: NC Travel Ban to Cost Minnesota Athletes Opportunity

docs.snippet: President Bush barred members of Belarus's government from traveling to the United States, citing electoral fraud, human rights abuses and corruption. His action followed the recent crackdown on the Belarussian opposition by the government of Pres...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Bush barred members of Belarus's government from traveling to the United States, citing electoral fraud, human rights abuses and corruption. His action followed the recent crackdown on the Belarussian opposition by the government of President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, whom the administration has called ''Europe's last dictator.''

headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Belarus: Bush Imposes Travel Ban
